body:
Update for 2022: With the [FCP close](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/44524#issuecomment-988260463) finished, this is no longer on a stabilization path, and will likely be removed from nightly.  The issue will remain open so long as it's referenced by an implemented `feature` in the compiler, however.

---

This is a tracking issue for the RFC "In-band lifetime bindings" (rust-lang/rfcs#2115).

**Steps:**

- [x] Stabilize `'_` (this has its own tracking issue, #48469)
- [x] ~~#15872: Enable elision in impl headers ([mentoring instructions here](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/15872#issuecomment-283987512))~~
  - Now tracked by `impl_header_lifetime_elision` in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/15872
- [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/45667: Support `'_` in where-clauses on functions. -- blocked on #15872 
- [x] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/46042: Enable implicit binders.
- [ ] Lint against single-letter lifetimes not confined to functions (?)
- [ ] Lint against single-use lifetimes: #44752
   * note: @pnkfelix added this as a "prereq", but its possible we do not have consensus that it is required (though @pnkfelix believes it was part of the RFC...)
- [ ] Apply to rustc, experimenting with naming conventions (e.g., working through the affect on rustc).
- [ ] Adjust documentation ([see instructions on forge][doc-guide])
- [ ] Stabilization PR ([see instructions on forge][stabilization-guide])

[stabilization-guide]: https://forge.rust-lang.org/stabilization-guide.html
[doc-guide]: https://forge.rust-lang.org/stabilization-guide.html#updating-documentation

**Unresolved questions:**

- What conventions should we use for lifetime names, and should they be enforced via lint?
  - Considerations:
    - To help avoiding accidental shadowing, [make it easy to know where a lifetime name is bound](https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2115#issuecomment-327629159) (and in particular if it is bound in some enclosing, possibly out-of-sight, scope).
    - [Permitting "well-known" names like `'tcx` and `'gcx` to be used consistently](https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/2115#issuecomment-328211495)
  - Some prior proposals:
    - Names bound in impls are upper-case (but: fails to permit well-known names)
    - Single-letter names cannot be bound across scopes (but: can't easily tell if longer names are bound across scopes or not)
- ~~Can we find an unequivocally-better syntax than `'_` for elided lifetimes?~~
  - These are now stable, so we didn't

Known bugs (possibly incomplete list):
 - [ ] https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/52532
